Change has been successfully merged
Can you start these with 'PEL:'
Done
It would sound a bit better if this were broken up into multiple sentences.
Done
I know this is a WIP still, but I wonder if you could just use 'memory_ctlr' since an OCMB seems close enough to that.

can i use poz_chip as now SBE came up with new SBE specification which is generic to all chips and it will have CHIP_TYPE additional data to differentiate. For now we have proc and ocmb to support for it.

These are customer viewable as on the web UI it says:  Event BDXXXXXX in subsystem: YYYY

Though the code may be common, for the end user a processor subunit is completely different than a memory subunit, and so we'd probably want separate subsystems there anyway.

Also, adding this would mean getting a PEL spec update through first.

So my suggestion now is to just use 0x20 on these fails, which is what hostboot uses for fails on the OCMB.
Acknowledged
OCMB I assume
Done

Is the callout passed in for these?  What is it?

Same question about the other entries below.

Callout data will be added after parsing the ffdc blob, at present not using SbeChipOpInvalidState so removing this error message but for SbeChipOpFailure callout data will be deduced from the ffdc data.
I forget, what code is it creating these errors?
https://github.com/ibm-openbmc/openpower-debug-collector/pull/50/commits
Done
hmm, this sounds like there's errors on the BMC's memory.
should i say bmc dimm errors?
For the current generation of systems (ignoring the future stuff for now) is it just a single app where you're creating these PELs?  Is it phosphor/openpower-debug-collector?
Done
this looks good, thanks.
